required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open Internet-based Survey and Natural Language Processing Project Analysing Written Monologues by Headache Patients
clinical_study.official_title: NLP Headache Open: an Open Internet-based Survey and Natural Language Processing Project Analysing Written Monologues by Headache Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Headache disorders are among the most prevalent medical conditions worldwide. The diagnosis of headache disorders is based on medical history taking. Digital solutions such as natural language processing (NLP) may be of aid to understand the linguistic aspects of headache attack and headache related disability descriptions by patients. Participants will provide a written description of their headache disorder. The results will hopefully lead to a better understanding of the potential use of NLP in headache disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Lexical diversity and differences between migraine and cluster headache
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Chi-square measurement of a word token used by migraine patients versus cluster headache patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of machine learning experiments for the correct classification of headache disorders
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Machine learning experiments to investigate the potential to build modelling algorithms that accurately classify the self-given diagnosis by the patient based on text.

secondary_outcome.measure: F1 scores of machine learning experiments for the correct classification of headache disorders
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Machine learning experiments to investigate the potential to build modelling algorithms that accurately classify the self-given diagnosis by the patient based on text.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Counts of word tokens of different headache disorder groups

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Counts of sentence tokens of different headache disorder groups

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Counts of paragraph tokens of different headache disorder groups

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: TF-IDF scores of word tokens of different headache disorder groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Migraine Disabillity Assessment [MIDAS] score calculation with text input
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Machine learning experiments to investigate the potential to build modelling algorithms that accurately predict the impact score from Migraine Disabillity Assessment [MIDAS] based on text.

secondary_outcome.measure: Migraine Specific Questionaire versie 2.1 [MSQv2.1] score calculation with text input
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Machine learning experiments to investigate the potential to build modelling algorithms that accurately predict the impact score from Migraine Specific Questionaire versie 2.1 [MSQv2.1] based on text.

secondary_outcome.measure: RAND SF-36 Dutch version score calculation with text input
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Machine learning experiments to investigate the potential to build modelling algorithms that accurately predict the impact score from RAND SF-36 Dutch version based on text.

intervention.description: Headache attack descriptions, Headache related disability descriptions, Questionnaires, MIDAS, MSQv2.1, SF36

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 year or older
- Have a headache disorder with at least one headache attack over the last three months
- voluntary participation
- accepted the patient information sheet and gave informed consent

facility.name: University Hospital, Ghent: Department of Neurology
